title: Understanding Calculated Fields
text: A calculated field is a new field created in a PivotTable that uses a formula to derive its values. It is not directly entered as data but is computed using existing data fields.

title: Purpose of Calculated Fields
text: Calculated fields allow you to perform calculations on data that is already in your PivotTable, enabling you to analyze and summarize data more effectively.

hintAnswer: a field with values not entered as data by determined by computation involving data in other fields
title: Identifying a Calculated Field
text: Which of the following best describes a calculated field?
choices: a field with values not entered as data by determined by computation involving data in other fields
a field that is given by the uploaded file and not manually entered into
a field that cannot be changed based on formatting and data
a field that is necessary for the creation of a graph
